title: On 29 November 2020, how many Learners will be "already enrolled" for the Coursera online course “Finding Purpose and Meaning In Life: Living for What Matters Most?"
preds: 11/28 Update - only 230 new sign-ups after two days over 500. This leaves 469 to be able to make it 89k. The totals don't seem to update at all during the day so it really boils down to how many sign up today. Downgrading the chance of getting over the 89k hump.
About 320 people have enrolled each day between Nov 1 and Nov 28. Without a surge, the final number will be just under 89,000. That surge seems unlikely.

88 531 - Demand seems to be tapering off , still got today and up to 5PM (ET) tomorrow  469 needed to nudge it over the 89K mark...  saturation vs recommendation, it is a good course (went through all the videos)  I'll go with the last push with a slight adjustment, maybe do the Brave Sir Robin if it looks to be going pear shaped tomorrow  :)
I assume that in these things there is often a last minute surge.
Fixing knee jerk. Probably going to end around 89,000, but the jump doesn't guarantee it will keep jumping.
88 301  - looks like it will take the 89K  not so sure about the 91K  will leave a foot in the door

Updating through 11/27 - 88,301. After a slow week, the total grew by over 500 each of the last two days (11/26, 11/27). Current average is now 309/day since 11/1 - which if the average hits when the totals are posted on the last two days (11/28 and 11/29) that would bring the total to 88,918. If at least 350 sign up each of the last two days 89k is reached.
Uptick in numbers perhaps due to the Disney effect, could be borderline for 91K
Looked at the numbers again, and they have slowed significantly in the last 10 days. There is only 87,245 as of today.
Probably not going to increase as much over Thanksgiving weekend.

Over 2 week period there was roughly 6K gain.  Generally assuming a similar pattern for next 2 weeks which woudl rouhgly be 91K.  As folks head into holidays I anticipate enrollments keeping at same rate and 91-94K gives greatest spread, so projecting this as the most likely range for 11/30.

Numbers continue to stay lower this week than last, adjusting downward as the daily average is now 283 new sign ups. Ranging off of that 283 (-50, +100) gets us 88,180 - 88,780. Small chance that the Thanksgiving holiday gives people some time off to think about starting the course to crack the 89k number, but I think this likelihood will continue to decline. To hit 89,001 there would need to be an average of 439 new sign ups a day (11/25, 11/26, 11/17, and 11/28) to see the reported number on 11/29 be the next tier.

Coursera will be doing Thanksgiving marketing on Soul/Disney partnership which will drive enrollments on this course given that this is the headliner course. This tells me that the course will have a larger growth rate from 16-29 than 1-16.

Updated forecast - slow weekend of registrations moved the total to 86,850 as of this morning. Using the rolling average of 308/d the likely total is now 88,700 with a range of 88,400 to 89,300. Would need to average about 360/d the rest of the way to clear the 89k mark. I still think there may  be a late surge to get into the upper 89k range

Updating... Since 11/1, the average increase has been 353 sign-ups per day. If you range off of that average (300 as the low, 450 as the high) the average is 89,619 sign-ups with a ranged high to low of 89,136 to 90,486. Not sure if there will be a mass rush to register before the end of week 1 or if it tails off completely. The total will pass 87k easily either this weekend or by Monday. Personally, I am through Week 1 of the course (auditing it). It is fascinating and really makes  you think about your "why".
Nice program nearly finished first week
with the additional publicity from being mentioned in GJO, more people will sign up.  (I did)
Thanksgiving will leave folks feeling unmoored and they will have more time to take online classes to find meaning.
I’m glad we are answering this (and will sign up for it myself) but pretty please can we also do Biden cabinet officials?
Following the trend line, I would expect around 90k enrollments, but there's some co-branding with the Soul Disney movie that could drive a spike by end of November.

Recent trends have the enrollment growing around 400 per day (through 11/17). If that holds, the overall would be around 90,330. Widening the range a bit (either it tails off to closer 300 or ramps up to an average of 500 per day) makes the range 89,131 to 91,531 Will track and see the enrollment trends... but would be most interesting is if there was a way to see the number of people that actually complete the course after signing up. That would be a more interesting question!
What an interesting and pleasant subject online course.. ^..^
